intro: Michelia vriesei, commonly known as the Vriesia magnolia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are broad, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers bloom in spring and are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their aesthetic appeal.
